overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a systematic approach to forecasting hourly oil temperature data. It begins with data inspection, identifies daily seasonality and potential outliers, evaluates multiple modeling approaches (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), and ultimately selects a median-based seasonal naive method due to the short 4-day dataset. The approach prioritizes robustness against anomalies while maintaining computational simplicity.
common_data_patterns: Daily seasonality (lowest temperatures at 4-6 AM, highest at 3-4 PM)
Potential outliers (notable temperature drop on last day)
Complete data without missing values in provided range
key_insights: Short time series (96 points) limits complex model applicability (e.g., SARIMA requires more seasonal cycles)
Median outperforms mean for robustness against outliers in hourly aggregation
Data reshaping into 4x24 matrix enables efficient hourly pattern analysis
Forecast assumes stable daily patterns for near-term predictions
Precision handling: Maintain 6 decimal places to match input data variance
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step statistical reasoning: Includes model comparison, outlier detection, data reshaping, and detailed median calculations while maintaining practical constraints.
